alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 02 at 1:16PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Goshen and southeastern Platte Counties through 145 PM MDT... At 116 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grayrocks Reservoir, or 18 miles east of Wheatland. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Torrington, Lingle, Fort Laramie, Yoder, Huntley, Jay Em, Fort Laramie National Historic Site, Veteran, Slater and Hwy 85 At Dry Rawhide Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; East Platte County; Goshen County
